title: Tottenham vs Red Star Belgrade team news: Line-up latest and more ahead of Champions League match
text:
Tottenham Hotspur play Red Star Belgrade this evening and will be hoping they can arrest their recent run of poor form.

Spurs were held last time out by Watford and are without a win in this season’s Champions League.

The club welcomed back Christian Eriksen from injury this week – although it remains to be seen whether Mauricio Pochettino will select the wantaway midfielder.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

There will meanwhile be a late fitness check on summer signing Giovani Lo Celso.

Here is what you need to know.

Manchester City (-) City started strongly with a 3-0 win over Shakhtar and remain in the top spot Getty Images

What is the team news?

Lo Celso is back in contention after a hip injury and could feature. Eriksen has meanwhile returned to full training after suffering an injury during the international break.

Ryan Sessegnon has also returned to full training although is believed to be some way off his debut.

What is the predicted Tottenham team?

Gazzaniga; Aurier, Sanchez, Vertonghen, Davies; Sissoko, Winks, Ndombele; Lucas, Kane, Son.

When is the match?

The match is today, Tuesday 22 October 2019.

What time is it?

The match gets underway at 8pm BST.

How can I watch the match?

The match will be televised live on BT Sport 3 and BT Sport Ultimate.

Can I stream the match online?

Yes. The match can be streamed live online via the BT app and website.

Match prediction

Tottenham know they have to win this evening to keep their Champions League hopes alive. They were dreadful against Watford on Saturday, but expect Pochettino to ring the changes.

We’re predicting a nervy affair but Tottenham should – should – get the job done. 2-1 to Spurs – with Son scoring a late, late winner.
